Āhāratthaṁ，[āhāra + tta] the state of being food. In the idiom āhārattaṇ pharati； Vin.I，199，of medicine，“to penetrate into food-ness” ，to come under the category of food； Miln.152，of poison，to turn into food. [According to Oldenberg （Vin.I，381） his MSS read about equally °attaṁ and °atthaṁ. Trenckner prints °atthaṁ，and records no variant （see p. 425）]. （Page 117）
